Recruitment

Join us in building a better Cal.

Why join us?

Through our office, our members get to build some of the most useful software for Cal students. If you choose to join our office, you will get to interact with some of the most important codebases for the university through Android, iOS, Rails, and Django Development. There are also other fantastic roles through which you can help to improve the office, including marketing, graphic design, videography, and product and project management roles. Your work will not only help to improve campus life, but will also inevitably prepare for opportunities beyond graduation. Our members have gone on to attain internships and full-time positions at companies like Google, Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Palantir, Uber, Salesforce, and Tesla. Check out our recruitment timeline to see how you can join our Office!

  • Info Session #1

    Tuesday, September 6th, 2016 | 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm

    HP Auditorium

    In this info-session, prospective candidates will learn about the office, including our projects, open positions, and how to apply. Candidates will also learn about the fun stuff that goes on in the office, including social events and other activities. The event will take place in HP Auditorium. RSVP through our Facebook event, which can be found here. Pizza will be provided.

  • Info Session #2

    Thursday, September 8th, 2016 | 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm

    HP Auditorium

    Much like in the first info-session, prospective candidates will learn about the office, including our projects, open positions, and how to apply. Candidates will also learn about the fun stuff that goes on in the office, including social events and other activities. The event will take place in HP Auditorium. RSVP through our Facebook event, which can be found here. Pizza will be provided.

  • Application Deadline

    Friday, September 9th, 2016 | 11:59 pm

    Online

    By this date and time, potential applicants must complete their online application. This application is done through a Google Form, which can be found here. In this application, you will fill out a number of short answer questions about your experiences and will also give your github handle and resume.

  • Group Interviews (Invitation Only)

    Tuesday, September 14th, 2016 | 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

    541 Cory Hall

    In this event, you will get together in groups of four and solve some fun problems. This will be a fun, hackathon-style challenge event where we'll get to see your ability to solve problems and work with others. Snacks will be provided.

  • Coffee Chats (Invitation Only)

    By Appointment

    The coffee chats are a great way for us to get to know you on a one-on-one basis. We look forward to learning about your interests and passions, as well as what your preferred technical skills are. Moreover, you get to ask us about our organization, including what we do and how we operate.

  • Final Decisions

    Sunday, September 18th, 2016

    On this day, you will receive the final decision that will tell you if you are accepted to the organization. If you are not accepted to the organization, it is no big deal - there have been plenty of engineers in OCTO who were not accepted into the organization the first time they applied but were able to get in the next semester. We highly encourage you to apply again!
